data.title: ‘How I Met Your Mother’ guest stars: 40 actors and other celebrities who appeared on the show
data.meta_description: Check out photos of 40 actors and other celebrities who made guest-appearances on "How I Met Your Mother"
data.text:
Hulu’s “How I Met Your Father” has continued its tradition of connecting to the original series in its second season, bringing back two more characters from “How I Met Your Mother” this year. First, star Neil Patrick Harris appeared in the Season 2 premiere, presumably as Barney Stinson, while actor Alexis Denisof appeared in a recent episode reprising his role as Robin’s former co-anchor Sandy Rivers.

While the follow-up to to the beloved comedy has had its own share of guest stars, including Cobie Smulder’s Robin in the Season 1 finale, Meghan Trainor and Eden Sher, “How I Met Your Mother” was known for its numerous cameos and guest stars, filling out a veritable “who’s who” from IMDB. Check out our list below featuring more than 40 actors and other celebrities who appeared on HIMYM over its nine-season run.

Malin Akerman

Portrayed Stella in the film written by Stella’s husband Tony, “The Wedding Bride” in season 5 episode of the same name.

Morena Baccarin

Appeared as a character named Chloe who Marshall dated in Season 2.

Bob Barker

Having grown up thinking Bob Barker was his father, Barney gets ready to meet his TV “dad” in the Season 2 episode “Showdown”

Rachel Bilson

Ted first met her character, Cindy, while teaching and later learned that she was his eventual wife’s roommate. Made four appearances over the course of the show.

Peter Bogdanovich

Appeared as himself at a social gathering during the episode “Robots Vs Wrestlers”

Anna Camp

Played Ted’s wedding date Cassie in a pair of Season 9 episodes.

John Cho

Appeared in Season 3 as Jefferson Coatsworth, who recruited Marshall to work for his “evil” law firm.

Bryan Cranston

Appeared in Season 2 as Ted’s boss Hammond Druthers. Later appeared in a flashback in Season 9.

Will Forte

Played Randy, one of Barney’s co-workers at Goliath National Bank

JoAnna Garcia Swisher

Another former college friend of the gang whom Ted kept missing out on chances to date over the years. Ted finally had a shot to date Maggie in the Season 5 episode “The Window”

Seth Green

Played former college mate Daryl whom Lily and Marshall reconnected with in Season 8

Judy Greer

Appeared as Royce, a woman Ted went to see “The Wedding Bride” with on a date.

Michael Gross

The “Family Ties” alum appeared in a pair of episodes as Ted’s father, Alfred

Tim Gunn

Appears in multiple episodes as Barney’s personal tailor.

Lucy Hale

Played Robin’s younger sister, Katie, who first appeared in a Season 2 episode before returning for Robin’s wedding in Season 9.

Katie Holmes

Holmes appeared in the Season 7 episode “The Slutty Pumpkin Returns” playing the titular character whom Ted had spent years trying to reconnect with.

Enrique Iglesias

Played Gael, a love interest of Robin’s that she met while in Argentina.

Chris Kattan

Appeared in the fictional film “The Wedding Bride” as Jed Mosely, Ted’s evil adaptation.

Stacy Keibler

Portrayed a bartender named Karina who hates guys in suits, much to Barney’s dismay.

Wayne Knight

The ‘Seinfeld’ alumnus didn’t actually appear in the Season 2 episode “How Lily Stole Christmas,” but he was the voice of the her apartment landlord.

John Lithgow

Appeared in multiple episodes as Barney’s biological father, Jerome.

Jennifer Lopez

Appeared in Season 5 as a dating self-help author who went toe-to-toe with Barney.

Camryn Manheim

Appeared as the founder of a computerized dating service that had trouble finding a match for Ted in a first-season episode.

Danica McKellar

First appearing in Season 1 as one of the many women who cross paths with Ted, Trudy goes on to appear again in the Season 3 episode “Third Wheel”

Lin-Manuel Miranda

Appeared as a bus passenger in the show’s final season episode “Bedtime Stories” where he got to show off some of his rhyming prowess.

Mandy Moore

Appeared in the premiere of Season 3 as a character named Amy who convinced Ted to get a tattoo.

Conan O’Brien

He appeared as an extra in the Season 7 episode “No Pressure” where he appeared briefly as a bar patron.

Amanda Peet

Played Jenkins, a female associate of Marshall’s at work who develops feelings for him in a fifth season episode also titled “Jenkins”

Katy Perry

Appeared as a woman whose name neither Ted, nor any of his friends, could remember in the Season 6 episode “Oh Honey”

Regis Philbin

The popular TV host appeared in a Season 4 episode where he and Marshall were both trying to find “The Best Burger in New York”

Laura Prepon

First appeared in flashbacks as Ted’s college girlfriend Karen. The pair reconnected in the present in the 4th season episode “Sorry Bro” before breaking up in the next episode.

Nicole Scherzinger

Appearing in the Season 6 episode “Glitter,” Nicole Played Robin Sparkle’s TV co-star Jessica Glitter.

Jane Seymour

Appeared as one of Marshall’s law professors in Season 2.

Martin Short

Appeared as Garrison Cootes, Marshall’s law firm boss in a trio of Season 7 episodes

Britney Spears

Britney played Stella’s receptionist in a pair of episodes during Season 3.

Tiffany

The ‘80s teen-pop icon appeared in the music video for Robin’s song “Sandcastles in the Sand” in an episode of the same name.

Tracey Ullman

Played Robin’s mother, Genevieve

Carrie Underwood

Played Tiffany, one of the many women Ted dated throughout the show in a fifth season episode titled “Hooked”

James Van Der Beek

Appeared as Robin’s first boyfriend, Simon. He first appeared in a Season 3 episode before two more brief appearances in later seasons.

Michael York

Also appeared in the episode “Robots Vs Wrestlers” as Jefferson Van Smoot, the host of the NYC society party.
